revised_title: Fission Fragment Damage to Crystal Lattices: Lead Iodide - Atomic Displacement
tldr: This study investigates the damage caused by fission fragments to crystal lattices, specifically in lead iodide. The researchers used a high-speed digital computer to simulate the displacement and motion of atoms in the crystal lattice. They found that channelling of knocked-on lattice atoms in lead iodide may increase the mobility of point defects and explain electron microscope observations of fission fragment damage.
